In Julia, Write a function `timezone_bumper(dt,bump)` that increases any provided timestamp by `bump::Int` hours (defaults to +3 hours). Make sure it works only for DateTime types and throws an error for Date types.

```julia
using Dates

function timezone_bumper(dt::Union{Dates.DateTime,Dates.Date}, bump=3)
    if isa(dt, Dates.DateTime)
        return Dates.DateTime(Dates.value(dt) + 60*bump*Dates.Hour(1))
    elseif isa(dt, Dates.Date)
        error("Cannot bump time for a Date object. Use DateTime instead.")
    end
end
```
This function will increase the timestamp of any provided `DateTime` type by `bump::Int` hours (or +3 hours if no argument is provided) and throw an error for `Date` types to ensure it works only with `DateTime` types.
